comment.author: 51293691@N07
comment._content: Actually I don't think it's one of the original Supermarine products. The Spanish airforce still had Spitfires on the inventory into the 1960s (if I remember correctly) and had re-engined them at some stage with something more modern than the Merlin. The bulge under the aircrafts' 'chin' is the giveaway. Spoils the lines really. Quite a few of these aircraft were used in the film "The Battle of Britain".

comment.author: 19658725@N00
comment._content:
Offhand guess: that's a Merlin in there. With a desert air filter maybe?

The film used Spanish (Merlin-powered?) versions of the Bf109; did it use any weird Spitfires?

comment.author: 51293691@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/19658725@N00]  Oh of course Tim, you're right. Demonstrates the frailty of memory! I think what threw me was the air filter - I've never seen a Spit with one fitted.
